intro: Racosperma abruptum, commonly known as the roughstem hakea, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the Proteaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in cylindrical inflorescences, which are typically visited by nectar-feeding insects. Racosperma abruptum is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system to access water. It plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat and is of interest in ecological studies.
